content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Could you please confirm whether a motorist has won their appeal after being fined for driving in this bus lane before 15th August 2014?
The signage was misleading on Broad Street as until that date as it stated that traffic camera enforcement started on 7th October.
Yours faithfully,
Clare Faulkner

Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 920
Dear C M Faulkner
Thank you for your recent request for information relating to PCN appeal
success details for the Broad Street Bus Lane which we received on
15/10/2015
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request, and will be
dealt with under the Freedom of Information Act.  The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act states that we must respond to you within
20 working days, therefore, you should expect to hear a response from us
by 12/11/2015.
In the meantime, if you have any queries please contact us on the number
below.
Thank you.
Yours sincerely,
Resources Business Support
Moorfoot Level 8 West Wing
Sheffield S1 4PL
Tel : 0114 20 53478
E-mail : [1]FOI @sheffield.gov.uk
? Please don't print this e-mail unless you really need to
_____________________________________________
From: C M Faulkner [[2]mailto:[FOI #297020 email]]
Sent: 15 October 2015 08:03
To: FOI
Subject: Freedom of Information request - Broad Street Bus Lane
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Could you please confirm whether a motorist has won their appeal after
being fined for driving in this bus lane before 15th August 2014?
The signage was misleading on Broad Street as until that date as it stated
that traffic camera enforcement started on 7th October.
Yours faithfully,
Clare Faulkner
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Please use this email address for all replies to this request:
[3][FOI #297020 email]
Is [4][Sheffield City Council request email] the wrong address for Freedom of Information
requests to Sheffield City Council? If so, please contact us using this
form:
[5]
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/change_re...
Disclaimer: This message and any reply that you make will be published on
the internet. Our privacy and copyright policies:
[6]
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/help/offi...
If you find this service useful as an FOI officer, please ask your web
manager to link to us from your organisation's FOI page.

Dear C M Faulkner,
Re: Freedom of Information Request – Reference FOI/920
Thank you for your recent request for information regarding PCN appeal
success details for the Broad Street Bus Lane, which we received on
15/10/2015.
Please find below, Sheffield City Council’s response to your request:
A breakdown of cancelled PCNs issued in this bus lane over the last two
financial years (to date) are shown below:
Broad Street Bus Broad Street Bus
Lane. PCNs issued in Lane. PCNS issued in
2014-5 2015-6
Cancelled - CCTV Exempt Vehicle 82 6
Cancelled - CCTV ops error 14 1
rep/challenge
Appeal - Accepted by Traffic 12 0
Penalty Tribunal (TPT)
Cancelled - No contest TPT 11 3
appeal
Cancelled - See Letter Details 11 0
Cancelled - CCTV ops error CCTV 6 3
team
Cancelled - Signing and Lining 5 1
incorrect
Closed - Waive Balance Discount 4 1
paid
Incoming -  Informal 3 0
Challenge.Letter Count
Cancelled - Unmarked Police Car 2 0
Cancelled - Wrong V R M 2 0
Cancelled - CCTV out of time to 1 0
iss PCN
Cancelled - Compassionate 1 0
reasons
Cancelled - Procedural 1 0
Impropriety
Cancelled - Processing Error 1 0
Cancelled - Vehicle Broken Down 1 0
Cancelled - Medical reasons 0 1
Cancelled - not reg in 0 1
England/Wales
Those cancelled for signing and lining incorrect reason are likely to be
ones due to drivers who claim they saw the information sign and thought
this was misleading.
Those no contested and accepted at TPT will be a mixture of such cases and
other circumstances – such as change of keeper, vehicle was exempt, etc.
I hope the information we have provided is of help to your enquiries.  If
you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed.  You can ask for an
internal review by either writing to the above address or by emailing
[1][Sheffield City Council request email].
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioners Office. The Information
Commissioner can be contacted at: The Information Commissioner's Office,
Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire SK9 5AF, telephone 0303 123
1113, or for further details see their website [2]www.ico.org.uk
Kind Regards,
Resources Business Support
Moorfoot Level 8 West Wing
Sheffield S1 4PL
Tel : 0114 20 53478
E-mail : [3]FOI @sheffield.gov.uk
P Please don't print this e-mail unless you really need to
